0.5: ...And the Arizal writes that a measure of Mishnayos [should] take precedence over everything, and through this one merits "neshama"...

101.8: Three steps. Look at the Magen Avraham.  And it is obvious that it is talking about (when the person in front) is within 4 Amos (of the person behind), or if he will enter the 4 Amos by stepping the three steps backwards, Olat Tamid.

622.4: Seven times. The reason is to accompany the Shechinah that rises upwards through the seven heavenly firmaments.

work: Ba'er Hetev on Shulchan Arukh, Orach Chayim
